Tucson nodds to Vestige, and suddenly comes up with an idea.  He still coul=
d move swiftly and dexterously, thanks to his ninjabot training.  If ever a=
 time where it was needed it was now.  He looks around quickly and notices =
that a formation of old metal debris lying on rubble resembles a teeter tot=
er lever. which he knew he could use as a vaulting platform. It would just =
take a second individual to step on the other end to send him upward for hi=
s maneuver.  He points to it.

" See that?  It resembles a catapoult lever.=
  One individual stands on one end, while the other jumps on the other end =
to send the first individual airbourne.  From there, I'm sure I can make it=
 to the bed. It's an old Ninjabot trick I learned during training.  And if =
I play my cards right, it'll be a maneuver they don't see comming."

With t=
hat he draws his sword, keeping an eye on the insects.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoo=
groups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > =
Tucson keeps firing as he continues to back up Vestige with all his dedicat=
ion. He finds that physical fire isn't much good against the insects but wh=
en he did excercise spiritual power, it seemed to help Vestige and himself =
immensely. He thinks for a moment and looks to Vestige.
> >
> > "Vestige, o=
ur power lies in something that these insects do not have. Our hearts. The =
simplest power of all, one that all living creatures are capable of express=
ing, and the one ability that these creatures do not possess. We must use t=
hat power now if we're going to vanquish our enemy and get Rodimus back. it=
 will unite all three of us, and only then, can we defeat this foe."
> >
> =
> His chest now pulsating as it had before, with the force of a beating hea=
rt filled with compassionate power. Several plates on his chest shift, as a=
 well protected heart like structure beats luminously. He looks to Vestige.=

> >
> > " Our compassion for each other, our loyalty to our comrades, our =
love for our fellow Autobots. That is the one power that can never be extin=
guished. You believe in that power, reach down, touch it, and allow yoursel=
f to allow it to flow freely within you. It will light all flames as it has=
 for centuries. We can do this Vestige, we can do this. For Rodimus Prime, =
our hearts are with him, as his is with us. Let's unite them and end this o=
nce and for all."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Vestige was, like Tuscon, firing to keep =
off these undoubteldy much
> stronger insectoid creatures. Laser beams and =
miniature missiles were
> flying throuygh the air in an effort to keep the =
creatures at bay.
> 
> Meanwhile the creatures continued to approach, doing=
 thier best to
> push through hail of weapons fire that came from the belea=
gered
> Autobots, however they did not appear to be faring well under the
>=
 onslaught from Tuscon and Vestige!
> 
> However it was at this time that t=
he door behind crashed open and
> several blue and white winged flying inse=
ctoids were flying in, thier
> stinger flashing in the light from this room=
!
> 
> "I get it now!" Vestige said as he turned to see thier new threat, "=
We
> must unite!" he said as if understanding the import of Tuscon's,
> alt=
hough not quite in the way that he meant them. Turning back to fire
> a few=
 shots at the new threat of flying Insectoids he glanced at
> Tuscon, "I ne=
ed to get to that bed!" He said talking about the bed the
> insecoids had b=
een working over and the figure that now lay prone on
> it.
